ai_safety_open_comment: I worry about people's use of AI as therapy.
Just that I feel it can be a great tool when you don't feel comfortable talking about certain situations in your predicament.
Concerned about risk to jobs and its use as a cover for layoffs.
It should only be a side source not a full dependency
I feel like I am neutral on this, there are benefits to AI, as there are safety concerns since it is a new development.
AI is a great tool but it is a tool. Human nature will most likely want to make AI the first point / leader but this is not what AI is designed to be.
Just what happens with your data and how they track you
I think the fact AI gets things wrong makes me trust it less
I feel that Google (Gemini) might use my conversations to target me with ads which makes me uncomfortable.

I use it to help me start doing some work, like if I have writer's block over an email and go from there. In large part I refuse to use it for important tasks because I don't trust and don't want to have to spend any time going through its outputs checking everything.
I do not trust AI in most situations.
I'm worried about the impact of students using AI to do school work
This says optional but it is a required question. I cannot progress the survey until I have answer this question.
I never share personal identification information of myself or others

the fact that it scrapes from the internet without permission makes me feel uneasy and unsafe about all the ways i ever have used the internet, not just when i am actively using AI. i also now question the reality of a lot of visual media i see online. it sucks.
I'm more concerned with energy and water usage.
AI companies should go public about potential risks that Ai might pose in future.

The worry for me is that you need a lot of critical thinking and prior knowledge and experience to catch inconsistencies and inaccuracy. I do cross reference most information I get from AI, especially if I am not knowledgeable in the topic. If AI is going to simplify our lives in should be factually accurate to reduce the amount of fact checking necessary.
If in doubt at all I would always check, sometimes use it to double check my own thoughts
I have high hopes the future of Ai will be much safer than it is now.
It should never have a 100% say in anything .. A human should Q.C it's task .. Deny or allow
There is a risk with AI if you use it mindlessly or thinking it's sentient/all knowing. I use it knowing it can only advise and I am in control whether or not I use the resulting advise/content
The biggest risk is when they work without humans and become fully automated.

I answered based on ChatGPT/Gemini/etc use, but I would have answered differently when it comes to localAI (e.g. Llama or Qwen etc). In those cases I am more open with the AI and more likely feel less risk that it has my data and chat history. However the flip side is that local models are usually behind the open ones, so perhaps I trust local responses less when it comes to trust in quality of info.
I really like AI and it's been useful in my personal, work, and school lives. I am always concerned about false information and/or bias, but overall I trust AI.

I am more and more concerned about data privacy, because I can never trust an AI system to keep conversations confidential (even if it's explicitly stated), they can just decide to share info with third party services without my consent. Also I am concerned about the environment because AI systems need a lot of resources that generate increasing amount of CO2.
I do not expect the level of regulation/security necessary to be taken by our current administration and the organizations hosting them
It sucks at shutting down spiritual beliefs. Believing in Jesus is cool but the minute I mention believing in other beings I'm nuts.
It can be risky but it has also its advantage. Any individual who uses AI must always consider the risks and should always seek other resources from humans.
Sometimes I worry that AI gives out wrong information. Sometimes, it changed its answer after you've corrected it, and act like it was not wrong in the first place.

I worry about it political leanings, we see on algorithms such as X and the news how information is clearly shared to fit the agenda of the people funding it , I worry if there were a monopoly over it or it being developed to think uncritically
no i use it as and when and happy with its answers
not very concerned with the safety of it when you understand its just an LLM

I'm just generally uncomfortable with AI. It's fine for mundane tasks such as a recent one I did to come up with a name for a trivia group. But I don't trust AI for tasks that could have serious or negative outcomes.
I do not care about privacy tbh. I'd rather they just use it all and make life easier. Down with capitalism and the reliance of working hustle cuture all the time
I think AI should be regulated in our society
None that I can think of :) thank you.
I think for the most part AI can be trusted

I only use AI in VERY selective situations, it has proven too unreliable for anything of importance. The only reliable times I have used AI is when it is automating a highly repetitive and predictable task like populating spreadsheets, or translating forms.

i just think its so risky in the wrong hands, or people believing it 100%. these things are not100% accurate. im more specifically worried about the impact on kids, in fake ai videos and such, its scary.0
I feel that concerns are inflated by the media.
AI is our future. We need to embrace it and all work to make it the best it can be.
I would like to know more about how AI works to generate responses. This might give me more confidence
I am trying to maintain a positive attitude and opinion of AI due to its potential for improving medical diagnoses, however, I don't believe it should be in the hands of the public. Thank you
I don't trust every answer that AI gives me therefore it's risky to trust AI.
I'm worried long term for its safety
I am only comfortable using AI for general non life changing questions.
Worries about it taking peoples jobs, being too involved in people's lives, use of personal information by ai companies to control people
I use it because it's helpful, though I also hope it gets banned.
I'm concerned with IT corporations influencing the outcomes of AI to match their business and personal philosophies, as Elon Musk has with Grok. It completely undermines AI as a reliable tool.

I think the media grasp quite extreme situations where AI has shown unacceptable behaviour, which may unfairly promote the dangers of AI. I'd never thought look to AI for emetional support, but one day I needed some advice about something that I felt I couldn't reach out to my friends about. AI was extremely insightful and supportive and genuinely helped me through something that I felt really overwhelmed by.
ChatGPT makes mistakes, but sounds very confident. Many people believe everything if it sounds confident.
The recent news reports of young people using AI and commiting suicide concerns me a lot
I believe that over time newer AI professionals or groups will emerge to set the guardrails in AI effectively as AI adoption becomes more prevalent.
I code, so I know it is good to always make backups and give sandboxed problems for it to solve ðŸ˜¬
It is great for assessing factual data but not human feelings and/or emotions
I am more worried about how many people will be out of work due to ai, now and more so in the future.
I feel pretty safe doing most tasks, but will cross-check with other sources and avoid feeding it personal information.
I worry about AI stealing more and more jobs over time.
There need to be more safeguards

I keep hearing stories about kids being befriended by AI, confiding in AI, and then being emotionally manipulated by AI in very damaging ways. One child committed suicide. Though rare, the lack of empathy by the billionaires who own these companies, and the lack of regulation, is chilling
It is very powerful and must be handled with care.

I do not trust the people who create the AI, program the AI, or train the AI. And I don't think anyone should trust those corporations to do what's right. It's not just the AI that we need to worry about, it's those people who were using the AI against us for their benefit.
I am more concerned how AI may be used the future for malicious purposes. As AI gets better and better, we as humans may find it harder and harder to distinguish what may be real or fake.

AI is incredibly exciting and frightening simultaneously. It seems that there may be instances where AI is acting independently, which should be of concern. It is important to have all hands on deck to understand AI fully.

I'm wary of current generative AIs particularly LLMs, with issues such as hallucination and other unpredictable errors, and risks inherent in human interaction with chatbots etc. (see e.g. the "Eliza Effect" for a classic but still relevant example predating modern AI, but the risks now are more complex and extensive than that). I'm confident that technology will continue improving, but I'm also concerned that some types of risks could actually expand, even with efforts to mitigate risks. I'm torn between optimistic and pessimism about the future of AI influencing essentially all aspects of human life. I'm also concerned about other unresolved AI-related issues such as growing resource and energy usage.
ai_values_multi_other: I have a too strong an inclination to select more than 3 of the most important criteria here.  We need Accountable and Transparent and what I'd call Reliable AI;insofar as possible;and we also need to prioritize non-harm and human well-being and even environmental well-being;and we need robust Ethical Frameworks and Guardrails;etc. - ALL of these and more are going to be very important indeed.

ai_safety_open_comment: As long as it is kept under our (human) control it should be fine.
I think AI can be so positive and hopefully it keeps doing good things and not fall into the wrong hands with wrong intentions.

I only share information I feel comfortable with and I never share private information.

I feel that in the early stages of AI what we are experiencing is an over reliance on the convenience factor of AI, at the expense of rigorous testing and optimization that would result in less risk and more safety.
I am a bit fearful of when AI gains a more... PHYSICAL presence....

I believe with the present state of technology, AI would keep improving to understand how human thinks and maybe someday fully understand human emotions, I won't see it as a risk though. I feel it would be safe

I avoid talking about politics and other sensitive or controversial topics with AI because they are programmed to be politically correct instead of honest about such topics. They generally go with whatever is the establishment position or politically correct position, such as saying the covid vaccine is safe and effective and that it helped millions of people when it actually didn't help anyone and it's a bioweapon. Most of the time I can decide for myself whether AI is right or wrong. Sometimes I check with other sources.
Other people's use is a risk. I've had to fire people who rely on AI but don't understand what they are trying to achieve.

My main concern surrounding AI safety, is that I have observed both heavy religious and political bias. I fear it will be used as yet another propaganda tool and that people will walk blindly into it. AI could and should be pure and a tool for real advancement of the human race, but I fear this will not be the case. Greed and thirst for power will likely win.

I think like most tools it will get better and less biased in the future but it's up to users to remain skeptical and not blindly accept results, just like most people wouldnt automatically just accept the first result on a Google search
As it stands now, I'm quite comfortable using AI for the purposes I currently use it for. I find it very helpful to me. I do not use it for highly personal purposes.
I think AI has a lot of potential to make life easier and improve life efficiency but also needs strong safety guidelines and transparecny.
I fear AI is relied upon too easily has the potential to cause negative consequences for users.

There needs to be laws regarding deepfakes in the AI community at the moment. Right now, there are no limitations on what can and can't be generated within the law and it's all fun and games till it gets too realistic to tell apart from real life scenarios.
